values: This is me being sad in the car on the way home from work last night. Still having computer issues and had to stay over 2 hours late. BOO!

Today was a pretty great day in Meganland. I got up and went to church, and afterward took my Aunt out to lunch and a movie for her birthday. We ate at Chili's: Guiltless Grill Chicken Sandwich......you know, cause we gotta watch the figures. Then we saw P.S. I Love You! It was a total chick flick and a total HOTTIE overload. You can't go wrong with chick flicks.....you just can't.

After I got home from the movies, I grabbed my grocery list and headed out to Wally world to obtain some grindage for this week. It really sucks going to the store when you're on a diet and you're hungry. I did good and only bought healthy things, so I rewarded myself with Subway for dinner. YUM!

My sister and I watched "Persuasion" on Masterpiece Theater tonight.....so good! Jane Austen really knows how to write the perfect love story. Anne Elliot, the main character, is 27 and unmarried (I can relate). She was considered an old maid and totally unmarriagable. Does this mean I'm a spinster? Spinster House at your service. Why can't I have some totally incredible and devastating romance in my life. .

I suppose that's all for now.......back to the salt mill tomorrow. I am seriously praying that the Lord will help me deal with my current trainee. She irritates the snot out of me for some reason, but I am trying to be kind.

Today I've been a lazy bum! I got up this morning and it was so cold in the house. We are not turning on the heat to try and save on the bills, but I tell you it gets so hard sometimes. I was wrapped up in pajamas, a robe, and bed stuff last night and was still a bit nippy. When I say robe, I mean my big mama jama Goodwill robe that I've had forever. I love this robe. It's ugly as sin, but it is so comfortable. I can't seem to part with it.

I've mainly been sitting at the computer all day playing around on Blogger and in Photoshop. I've also had my iTunes on shuffle.....go to my Last.fm page to see what I've been listening to.  Feel free to friend me!

I guess that's about it for the first post of the new year. Tomorrow morning is church (YAY!) and then I'm supposed to be taking my dearly beloved Auntie Andra out for her birthday. Should be a good day all in all. 

I hope everyone has had a fantastic new year so far!

Hey there everybody! I finally got all my Christmas shopping done!! Yesterday was torture because I found out the laptop backpack that I had gotten my dad was not the one he wanted. That one had to go back to the store, and then I was running all over town to every office type place, and no one had it in stock. I finally ended up having to buy it on amazon.com, wrapping a picture of it and writing on it that he will get it on Wednesday. Nice, huh? Oh well, at least he'll get what he wanted. I kind of went overboard this year since my parents are going through some financial woe. I really hope everyone likes their presents! My dad made one of those jibjab snowball fights with all of our boxers! My parents have two boxers, we have two, and my brother has one......it's pretty darn cute. You can go here to see it! I hope you all have the Happiest of Holidays!

Oh man......I totally know I shouldn't have, but I had to have it!! At least I get a rebate so it will eventually be free! 



It should be here in 2 days..........I can't freaking wait to get it!!

Hope you're all doing well!

Hello all!  Just stopping in quickly to post.  It's been a super long week........we had to let someone go yesterday who just wasn't getting the material.  I feel really bad and like a failure, but it had been over 3 weeks and she still wasn't catching on well.  Then there's some family drama going on that I can't really get into.  All in all......pretty crappy day. 

This past weekend I saw two movies:  Enchanted and August Rush.  I have to say that I loved them both.  Enchanted was really funny and just made me feel good......I left the theatre in such a cheerful mood and humming all the songs.  I loved the way that it made fun of itself, and Patrick Dempsey looked great. 

August Rush was very good as well.  I don't think it's for everyone and could definitely be classified as a chick flick.  There are a LOT of unbelievable parts of it, but if you disregard that, it's very good.  Again with this movie.......very good music.  I love the soundtrack to pieces.  Jonathan Rhys-Meyers sings in it and does a really good job.  I would recommend it for a feel-good chick flick.  If you're looking for some dramatic indie movie, this ain't it.  I thought it might be from the previews, but no.  I left there smiling though, so it was all okay! 

I hope you are all doing well.  I am so thankful this week is over to tell you the truth.  I need to start fresh as of tomorrow!

Comment and ask for your letter.  I'll give you a letter.  In your journal, list 10 of your favorite songs that start with that letter.
rock2rooney
 gave me the letter Y, and so here ya go......all the songs are downloadable if you click!!  :)

You Don't Know What Love Is (You Just Do as You're Told) by The White Stripes

You Look So Fine by Garbage

You Can Bring Me Flowers by Ray LaMontagne

Your Love Will Never Change by Dave Barnes

You're the Only Place My Heart Has Ever Been by Josh Groban

You Give Me Something by James Morrison

You Can't Stop the Beat from The Hairspray Soundtrack

You and I by Michael Buble

Your Eyes Open by Keane

Yesterday by Mary Mary

So, as promised, I am prepared to tell the news that I have.  Remember when I told you all that I'd decided to go back to school??  Well yeah, this new position came up at work, and it would be so wonderful if I could get it.  The problem is that if I were to get it, I would have to go to Philadelphia for a week for training......this would not fit in with a school schedule.  After much consideration, I've decided to wait until the spring semester to start back to school.  I know, I know......it seems like I keep putting it off, but I really do want to go back to school, so I'm going to do it.  I just need to see if this position pans out first.  Keep your fingers crossed, peeps!

This weekend was busy busy busy.......we had a concert Saturday night and Sunday morning.  Then my Dad and I are filling in with another group for a concert, and we had to do some heavy practicing for that.  When I left there, I was completely worn out!  

Then Sunday night, we got a new puppy!!!!  It's a little boy boxer named Bentley, and he is adorable!!  Here are some pics:





Then my parents got a white female boxer named Callie!!  Here is that baby:



My brother also got a boxer boy, but I don't have any pictures of him yet.  We were seriously doggin' it up last night!  

Here's the questions I got asked on the meme from
abvj:

1. Edward Cullen or Jack Sheppard?
This is such a hard question, but I'm going to have to go with Jack Sheppard......I have some serious love for the Jack!
 
2. First ever girl crush on a celeb?
Hmmmm.......probably Joey from Nsync or Kirk Cameron LOL!
 
3. Most embarassing moment.
I have so very many, but I guess I'll have to go with the time I forgot the words to the song I was singing at my friend's wedding......I completely blanked on the second verse of "You Light Up My Life"!  I was so  nervous, and I just started making up words LOLOL
 
4. Favorite comfort food.
Hmmmm......I'm fond of cheesecake with cherries or strawberries, and if there is none handy I'll go with any type of pasta.

5. if you had to pick, what song would you choose to listen to for the rest of your life?
Dear Lord, this is the hardest question ever!!!!  I have soooooo many that it would be hard to narrow it down to just one, but I'll go with "He Will Deliver Us" by the McRaes for my gospel side, and for the rest of music I'm going to have to go with "Never Tear Us Apart" by INXS......I know that's pretty gay, but that song never gets old to me. 

I hope you're all doing well!  LOVE!

1. List seven habits/quirks/facts about yourself.
2. Tag seven people to do the same.
3. Do not tag the person who tagged you or say that you tag whoever wants to do it.

Tagged by:
rock2rooney


1.  I really really love Mary-Kate and Ashley movies and other complete cheesiness like Hannah Montana and That's So Raven.  I'm totally kvelling at the thought of watching High School Musical 2 this Friday.....it might be the highlight of my week LOLOL!  I'm a goobatron!

2.  I was born with a recurring tumor on my right foot....it was removed twice when I was a child, and now contains a lot of scar tissue.

3.  While driving, I blast music super duper loud and sing at the top of my lungs....my favorites are show tunes, where I totally act out the songs with hand movements and all......it's really dangerous, and I KNOW people give me the weirdo look when they pass me.

4. When I was in high school, I was in seven or eight plays, and my senior year I had the lead in our production of FAME.....that's right people........remember my name.

5.  I used to be a complete New Kids on the Block fangirl......I had the NKOTB Barbies and their stage.  Once, I totally laid on my bed and cried to "I'll Be Loving You Forever".  Like I said......goobatron!

6. I used to have a fake medical kit, and my Pawpaw would lay on the couch and let me doctor him up.......he dubbed me Nurse Lulu Magilicuddy! 

7.  When I was a kid, I was completely spoiled and stubborn......if I didn't get my way, then I would use my made-up "swear word", which was SHOBERTY!  When people asked me what it meant, I said, "magazines don't hold".....apparently, I was weird on top of spoiled and stubborn.

So yeah, there's my answers LOLOL!  I don't want to tag anyone (I'm totally breaking rule number 3!), but I would totally love to read yours if you want to fill it out!!

In other news, my sunburn has stopped hurting, and has moved into the peeling stage......no fun at all.  Tomorrow night, we are having a Mary Kay party......I'm totally addicted to Mary Kay.  I hope it turns out good.  I have some other news to relay to you all, but I'll have to save it for later on this week, cause I am tired and I need to go to bed......and it's a long story.  I hope you're all doing well.......LOVE!!

PS--
sarcastic_funny
......I totally keep meaning to email you, but it has been crazy busy around here......and I do mean CRAZY!  I haven't forgotten you....we must dish about the book!  I will try my hardest to email you this week!!  :))

I am extremely sunburned....it hurts.  It hurts bad.  I am purple......just call me Barney.

More to come when I've recovered......

LOVE!

Yes, I know, I have been MIA lately....like seriously MIA!  Please don't be mad at me!!  I have had some crazy weeks and lots of things going on lately.  I have not forgotten any of you, I promise!  

Tomorrow I leave for my vacation to Atlanta and Savannah, GA, and at the end of the week I'll be going to a release party for Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.....I'm so majorly excited!!  I saw the movie on Wednesday, and it was simply amazing!  Definitely my favorite Potter movie thus far by leaps and bounds!

Ok guys, I got a new shift at work recently, and since I finally get off at a decent hour, I've made a big decision.....I'm going back to school!  I've been thinking about it, and I really really don't want to do what I do now forever.  I mean, I make good money, and probably more than I'd make being a teacher, but it just doesn't make me happy.  I really like being in school, and I miss utilizing my brain and learning new things.  This is going to be a big and costly step for me, but I really think it's the right one.  I'm praying that everything will work out so that I can go to school at night when I get off of work, and this way I won't have to change my schedule, since that takes an act of Congress nearly at my job.  I'm kind of excited about this!  

As of tonight, I'm officially going on internet lockdown so that I will not be spoiled in any manner for the Harry Potter book, and also, I'll be on vacation, so I won't be able to catch up to y'all's journals until after, but I promise, promise, promise that when I get back, I will definitely do this!  I really have missed you guys!  I hope everything is going well for you all!  I loves yas!

Remember when I said I was going to make a real post last weekend?  Yeah, well, it turned into this weekend.  I hope everyone had a good holiday.....I know I did.  A lot of family time, and I loved that.  We had a really good time, joking and laughing, and no fussing and fighting, which is always a plus.  We had a cookout, and then later played cards until the wee hours of the morning.  

This week at work was nice, since it was a short week.  I wish every work week only consisted of four days.  I kept myself busy listening to an audio book "Match Me if You Can" by Susan Elizabeth Phillips.  I loved every second of it, and highly reccommend either the book or audio book to everyone.  I'm in the process of getting her backlist now.  Has anyone read her?  What is your favorite book by her?  I'm so excited.....I love finding new authors!!

I'm seriously enjoying So You Think You Can Dance.  That show just makes me happy......and the audition episodes for this show are soooooo much better than American Idol.  They don't seem to base the whole of the episodes making fun of people and putting people down.  They tend to show a lot of the good people, too.  Benji came back the other night, and I love him so.  I'm excited for his sister.  I hope she makes it to the big show, cause maybe I just love the Schwimmer clan altogether.  Plus, they were so funny laughing at their dad with the electric sign AHAHAHAHA!  I'm excited for the Vegas rounds next week.  

I tried to watch Hallmark channel's version of Marco Polo tonight because Ian Somerhalder is in it, and he is totally my eye candy.  I had to switch it very quickly after I found out that they had cast Brian Dennehy as Kublai Kahn.......do what?  Who is casting this mess LOLOL!

I am currently watching the season premiere of Hex on BBC America.  Last season was so strange, but this one so far is much better.  Azazeal is so sexy.

Oooh, I saw Pirates of the Carribbean 3, and whoa!!  I loved it so very much.  Not just because I love Johnny ever so much, but also because I love Orlando!  So, he's not the best actor in the world........what of it?  He is so very fine, and he was at a personal best in this film, especially at the end.  I don't know why he looked better after he died and became the captain of the Flying Dutchman, but he so did.  It was almost like his hair was darker and his skin was tanner or something.  YOWSA!    The extra scene at the end after the credits is well worth staying for.....so super sweet!  Nearly made me swoon.  I also downloaded the soundtrack to the movie.....it's wonderful. 


42 DAYS UNTIL MY VACATION!!! 

Now I'm going to lay on the couch with my doggie and watch my show!  Hope you're all having a great weekend and have a lovely forthcoming week.  I'm trying to post more, I really am.......and I'm trying to do better about commenting your journals.  LOVE!

I was just thinking......I need to update more.  I've gotten pretty bad about posting journals lately, but hopefully I can start updating regularly again. 

So, Happy belated Mother's Day to all the Mothers on my f-list!  My family went out to eat with my Mom and had a pretty good time just being together.  Of course, this outing was preceded by one of our famous insane fights about nothing that get blown out of proportion, but that's neither here nor there.  My family is so strange LOL!  We can seriously be fighting with each other one minute and the next be happy as can be.  It's because we're a very close-knit group.  I've had friends actually tell me that our family's too close........not so.  We just love each other, and have learned through some pretty hard-knocks that there are very few people in this world you can truly count on, and we back each other up 100%.  We don't always get along perfectly, but we get over it fairly quick.......well, most of us anyways.  My dad is sort of a grudge-holder.  The first time my sister and I moved out and got an apartment, he didn't speak to us for 3 months.......a very long 3 months.  We tried to resolve the issue, but there's one sure trait my family members all share, and that's pigheadedness.  One day, though, things were just okay again.  We helped them move and he helped us get our dog, so that made it all better LOL!  We don't really talk and resolve our issues, we sort of just let them be over.  

Wow, that just kept on going, didn't it?  I don't know where it came from, as that was not what I was going to post about, but anyways.....also, yesterday my Mom got a brand new car!  A 2007 Nissan Sentra, and she is so excited!  She has really been in need of a car for awhile now, and she truly deserves this, so I'm really happy for her.   Here's a picture of us when I was a little girl:

  


Here's another thing that's been on my mind.......the subject of my love life.  Ok, so I firmly believe that God is going to send me the right person when it's time, and I'm trying to pray about it and be content with it, but why does everyone have to keep bringing it up?!  Every time it's the same thing......you're too picky, Megan, or you have a wall up, Megan.  I just don't agree with this!  I am fully open to the possibility of meeting someone, it just never seems to happen.  I'm not the kind of girl that guys just naturally gravitate to.  I'm the kind of girl that a guy has to get to know, and then to like.  My sister tried to set me up with this guy who liked her first!!!!  NOO!!  I do not want her sloppy seconds!  She is way prettier than me, and any guy who would like her is sure not to want to take a second glance at me.  I'm not picky.....I don't think this makes me picky.  

In regards to this "wall" I have up........I'm just a naturally shy person.  It took me years to break out of my shell, and this only occurred after I got into doing plays and performing on stage, but that girl still lives inside me.  When I get to know someone, I can't be shut up, but put me next to a stranger, and I revert.....very quickly.  Lots of people in my family find nothing wrong with conversing with total strangers.......I just can't do it.  And it mortifies me when they do it.  It has taken me a long time to get to where I am now.  They don't recognize that I do the best that I can.  

Another problem is that I really don't have any place to meet guys.  I don't go out to clubs or bars, or any kind of party scene.  My work is filled with women and men who are either gay, married, or old.  My church is a very small church, and all the males there are either related to me or old.  And I think we've established that the only type of guys I meet at our concerts are old people.......because that is our target audience (southern gospel does not draw the young crowd).  What should I do?  Someone even had the nerve to suggest match.com......excuse me, I do not need Dr. Phil to find me a husband.  YIKES!  

I know everyone means well, but I feel like Bridget Jones........the single girl in a sea of "smug marrieds".  *sigh*

Now that I've ranted and raved, I guess I should close this thing out.  Before I go, I will give a few TV show and movie thoughts:

Heroes--the freaking best show on television.  The stuff with Hiro and his dad was amazing tonight, and I love how everyone has converged on this city.  Linderman's death was so kick-butt!  DL must live.  The montage at the end was so perfect, and then Sylar's creepy self "Boom"........next week's season finale is going to be amazing!

LOST--has been blowing my mind lately.  The Jacob stuff was so creepy, and Ben is a psychopath.  I love Juliet.....I don't care if she's good or bad, I just frickin' love her.  One of the most interesting characters to come along on that show.  I almost care more about her than the regular Losties.  

Grey's Anatomy--has been ticking me off royally.  I'm so sick of the Meredith/Derek yo-yo......I want off this train.  I can't ride it anymore, I'm getting seasick.  George/Izzie was weird at first, but I'm slowly warming up to it.  The elevator kiss was smokin' hot.  I feel bad for Callie, cause I love her so.  Christina and Burke need to get it together.  I know everyone had different reactions to the spin-off episode, but I really loved it.  I can't wait for the show, and I will definitely be watching.....if only for Tim Daly, whom I have loved for years, and is still frickin' fine (and needs to be on my screen since The Nine got cancelled :()  

American Idol--has been b-o-r-i-n-g this year.  I really don't care who wins.  Isn't that sad?  Of course I will tune in, but it will be who it is, and I won't be voting.

Supernatural--rocks my socks.  Truly one of the best shows that nobody's watching.  It has all the elements that I love, and hello......super hot boys.  Sammy must live!  Dean is my man......back off, women!

Spiderman 3--sucked.  Period.  I loved Tobey in the first two movies, but he just stunk it up in this one.  If I saw any more tears roll down his face, I was going to scream.  And one thing I can't get over.......he hit her.  I don't care if it was Evil Spidey.......he hit her.  Harry was the best thing about the movie, and then they marred James Franco's lovely face, and then had a crappy ending for him.  *sigh*  I just hated it.  I couldn't help it.


And that's all I've got people.  This is what happens when you bottle stuff up forever.  Please comment me if you love me.  I hope you all have some wonderful days ahead of you!  LOVE!

Guys.....I just sat through the best hour of television I've ever seen!   

Heroes is the most awesome show on television right now....I kid you not.

Could I be more excited about this??!?


<lj-embed id="2" />

It's going to be a cinematic adventure to remember! :)

Cause shoes are cool, and this makes me giggle!

<lj-embed id="1" />

How's everyone been??!?  All's been quiet here of late.......just chillin and enjoying my new car something fierce.  My cousin and aunt came into town recently and paid me a visit.  I was so glad to see them!  My cousin is truly one of my bestest friends in the world, and I wish she could be here all the time.  We have so many things in common, and that's a rare thing when you have strange interests like mine LOL!  Nobody in my family gets my Harry Potter addiction as much as she does.  

Speaking of Potter.....this summer is going to be insane!  The week of the book release I'm going down to Atlanta to visit the cuz, and we're taking a road trip to Savannah, GA for a few days, which should prove to be a good time.  We're going to take some ghost tours (SPOOKY!!), and take in the local sights.  We might go out to Tybee Island as well.  Then we're coming home and attending a book release party for the Deathly Hallows release (getting our books at midnight, baby!!)!  I've never been to one of these, but thought it might be a good time since it's the last book.  I'll be returning home that weekend. 

THENNNNNNN.....I'll be travelling back down there a couple weeks later, cause we have.......JOHN MAYER TICKETS!!!!  HOOTY HOO!!  I'm so excited.  I have not always been a Mayer fan, but have recently come to appreciate him more and more.  I can't wait to see him in person!

We're calling it the "Summer of Dreams".......appropriate, methinks.  

How crappy is this season of American Idol?  Last night was just the icing on the cake of badness for me.  Gina was one of my faves, and it upset me greatly to see her leave........especially when that little chick Sanjaya WAS NOT EVEN IN THE BOTTOM THREE.  Can anyone explain this madness to me?  I mean, I know about Howard Stern and votefortheworst, but seriously??  I know they're trying to be funny, but regardless of what you think about the show, it IS and has proven to be a stepping stone for many people to fulfill their dreams.  I just think it's wrong to be such a dream-ruiner and keep the worst around forever.  Just my opinion.......I'm just about done with the show this season. Once a couple more people are gone, I'm out.

I guess I've rambled on long enough......I hope you're all doing well and having incredible weeks.  

Happy Birthday to my cousin,  
autumnclarity
!!!!  I made you a little present, cause I loves you!!

Snape....that's who......

<object width="425" height="350"><param value="http://www.youtube.com/v/oWjCXt9ZTew" name="movie"></param><param value="transparent" name="wmode"></param><embed width="425" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/oWjCXt9ZTew" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" height="350" wmode="transparent"></embed></object>

After much looking and much haggling.......today I finally got a car!!!

HOOTY HOO!!



A Chevrolet HHR!!  The color I got was burgundy, and I got a really good deal on it!

So all is well, and thank the Lord it all worked out!

Here's what I hate:  Car shopping.  I just got back from looking and I feel like it'll never happen.  I absolutely DO NOT want to be stuck with a high payment.......I mean, I could probably afford a substantial payment, but I am just not willing to do it.  I like to be able to have some wiggle room in my finances.....I like to not have to worry about whether I'll have enough gas money or not.  Then again, I want a nice car.....actually I want a nice, small SUV.  I'll be upside down on my current car which sucks, and is also part of the problem.  The dilemma is......do I sacrifice my monetary comfort zone and peace of mind, or do I settle for a car that I may not be completely thrilled with?

*le sigh*  I hate worrying about stuff like this.  I feel tied up in knots, and my eyes hurt from crying.  I am going to have faith that it will all work out according to how it should be, but it sure is hard.  May I just say that car salesmen are really pushy jerks????  This guy made me feel about an inch tall and why would I ever think I could get the payment I want to get.  I try to let my dad deal with them because he knows how to play "the game", but it still makes me feel awkward and embarrassed.  We are going out again in the morning.....funness.  </sarcasm> </rant>
 
I am so glad this week is over......it just brings me one week closer to the vacation I'm taking in July!!  My cousin and I are going to Savannah, GA for like 4 days, and then we're coming back to attend a Harry Potter book release party!  I'm super excited, not only because I get to spend time with one of my bestest friends, but because I can get away from HERE.....and from work.

Speaking of work......I work in an office with mostly women.  This is not a good thing, people.  I get along so much better with guys...they're not half as petty as women.  I constantly feel like they're talking about me behind my back because I *know* they talk about everyone.....I've heard them do it.  I truly try to be nice to everyone and treat everyone the same, but I still can't shake the feeling that they're whispering.  Maybe I'm paranoid........I'm just trying to keep a low profile, do my work, and go home LOL!  I can't take the drama.......I need less drama in my life, not more.

Next weekend my aunt and cousin are coming up and I'm off the following Monday, so at least there's that to look forward to as well.  

On a musical note, I downloaded a John Mayer CD where he does acoustic versions of all his songs, and it pretty much rules my world.  There is nothing better than a good acoustic guitar and someone's voice.........the only thing that comes close is just a piano and someone singing.  The simplicity is what makes it even more beautiful.

I guess that's all for now......I hope you're all doing well!  Have a great weekend, and much love and hugs to you all......heaven knows I could use some hugs right about now.

WOW!  I just checked and it's been a long while since I've updated!  I really have no clue as to why......possibly because not much has been going on.  

Our new CD's arrived, and they look really great.  The artwork came out nicely, and I'm about as satisfied as I'm going to get with the final project.  I'm telling you, I hear about fifty gajillion mistakes every time I listen, but that may be because I'm trying to find them.  We worked a long time on getting it like we wanted it, and so I will resign myself to what it is.  It can't be changed now, at any rate.  

We had a concert last Friday and it went really, really well.  The place we sang at is always a fun time.....you haven't lived until you've seen four old grannies onstage doing leg kicks AHAHAHAHAHA!  It would be too hard to explain, but suffice it to say, hilarity ensued.  The other group we were singing with did a version of "King Jesus", our new signature song, and my dad (wrongly) decided that we were going to sing it as well.  I'm not trying to brag, but we really did do it better than them LOL!  They were really nice and said sure we could do it, but I still felt a little wierd about it.  But it all came out well, and we came out with some good sales, too.  No stalkers were present, and that's always a plus!

Work has been the same-old, same-old......it never changes.  Truly, the one constant in my life.  I don't know how I'd survive if I didn't have my iPod.  I am officially all caught up on 24, and am waiting anxiously like the rest of the world for the next episode.  I started season one of Prison Break on a friend's recommendation, and I'm loving it so far.  Because of my iPod, I now watch every show known to man....it's sad really.  Oooh, another thing I'm loving on my iPod.......podcasts.  There are some really good and funny ones out there.

I've been busy as a bee this weekend making some icons and such.....to see proof of my productiveness, you can check out my icon journal

honkforicons
.   I didn't even leave the house today.

We had another Guitar Hero tournament tonight, and I came in second.  It's really upsetting me that my sister rules the Guitar Hero world.....I have got to step up my game.

For the romance readers on my list, I just finished a wonderful historical trilogy by Jen Holling:  "My Wicked Highlander", "My Devilish Scotsman", and "My Shadow Warrior".  I highly recommend them.  Why can't romance heroes come to life?  I need one.

And yeah, that's about it......I hope you have all been doing well!  Have a great weekend!

I finished Season 4 of 24 today.  There are no words for the complete and utter awesomeness of this show.  I have loved many a show in my day, but I think this one truly reigns supreme as the best show ever.  I feel like such a fangirl with my love for Jack Bauer.  Tomorrow I start Season 5, which I'm told is the best season of all, so I'm pretty excited.  What will I do when I don't have 24 to occupy me at work?  I've been informed by friends that the next series I need to start is Prison Break, and so I plan to download that when I'm all caught up to the present on 24.  Everyone raves over it, so I'm sure it's going to be great!

Heroes tonight was pretty durn exciting, and next week looks to be even better.  Suresh needs to wake up and smell the Sylar.  I mean, how obvious was it when he was grabbing his ears and stuff?  You're supposed to be a man of science and reason, Mohinder.....come on!  I'm glad Claire finally told her crazy daddy off.  Peter is the coolest guy ever.....when he flew, I literally screamed.  Poor Simone....that was so unfortunate.  I love everything about this show.....



Tomorrow night is American Idol, and I really can't wait for it......finally we get down to the good stuff.  I don't really have favorites yet, but I'm sure it won't take me long.  I hope we see some front-runners emerge as they usually do at this stage of the competition. 

Speaking of competition.....anyone been watching Grease:  You're the One that I Want?  It makes my little broadway-lovin heart go pitter-pat.  There are some really really talented singers on there.  

I guess enough TV talk, huh?  Work is going okay right now.....today I worked an early shift and only got about 5 hours sleep last night.  I'm about to fall over in my chair typing this.  Our new CDs are coming in this week!  They were mailed today, so should be here in a couple days.....just in time for our concert this Friday.  We're singing in a little town called Monett, AR.  Never heard of it?  Yeah well.....it's the kind of place where the gas stations close at 10, if you know what I mean.  It's not the craziest place we've ever sung......we've been to Bucksnort, MS before.  I kid you not....that's the real name of the town LOL!  We had a good crowd last time we were in Monett, though, so maybe it'll be a good one.  

I guess that's about it for now.  I hope you all have a really great week, and I send out much love to you!

Music Meme:
- List 10 songs that begin with the letter given to you and explain why you picked them. 
- If you want to play, ask and I will give you a letter.
- 
bookcollector
gave me the letter N.

1.  Never Ever by All Saints- I just adore this song......I even like the talking in it, which is strange, cause I am not a big fan of talking during songs.  I'm a sucker for harmony and these girls have it in spades.

2.  Never Saw Blue by Shawn Colvin- Because Shawn Colvin is pretty much a musical genius.  "And I never saw blue like that before.....across the sky, around the world.  You've given me all you have and more.  And noone else has ever shown me how...to see the world the way I see it now.  Oh I never saw blue like that before....."  Words familiar?  They should be...they're at the top of my LJ.

3.  Never Tear Us Apart by INXS- Um hello....it's INXS.  Michael Hutchence has one of the sexiest voices ever.

4.  New York State of Mind by Billy Joel- I am a huge Billy Joel fan, and this is one of my absolute favorites.  That man knows how to sing a song and make you feel it.

5.  Not Ur Girl by Katharine McPhee- Cause it's fun and makes me want to dance.

6.  Nothing Fancy by Dave Barnes- Nevermind that Dave Barnes is hot, and nevermind that his voice is soooo sexy.  This song makes the list for the lyrics alone.  "There's nothing fancy about the way I love you.  There's nothing you could not find in any other man.  There's nothing fancy about the way I love you.....but I love you as hard as I can."  You guys should check him out.

7.  Nothing Compares 2 U by Sinead O'Connor- I know she's crazy, but this song is timeless and wonderful.  It gets me everytime I hear it.

8.  Norwegian Wood by The Beatles- One of my favorite Beatles songs.

9.  No Such Thing by John Mayer- Because I love John Mayer, and my favorite one by him ("Clarity") starts with a C.  LOL!  This one will do, though.

10.  Never Say Goodbye by Bon Jovi- I had to find a song to represent my love for 80's hair bonds.  Bon Jovi forever!!

People are lying to us about this holiday......it's not about love!!!

It's about everyone around you at work getting hugongous flower arrangements and life-size stuffed animals and diamonds and candy.

And you sitting there with nothing watching everyone ooh and aaah and compare their gifts, trying to one-up each other.

Oy.......it's days like these that make me want to scream.

Maybe I'm sick of all this crap and think it's really stupid......

or more likely, I'm jealous of all this and wish I had a cool gift to lord over someone's head.

Oh well......my Mom and Dad at least called to wish me Happy V-day and tell me they love me.

I am loved by someone at least.

I hope you were all loved by someone.....and if not, you're loved by ME!!  ;-)

WHOA!  Tonight's episode of House was out of this world!  We got some Huddyness, some Cam/Chase-ness, and a humongous tapeworm!

I don't know if I really want House with anyone, though......I can't really picture him in a relationship LOL!  Can you imagine this?  The only time we've really seen it is with the psycho hose beast Stacy, and that was almost enough to make me gag.  I do love the flirty love/hate relationship between House and Cuddy.  

I heart Wilson......he pretty much just makes me happy.

Chase's smile at the end was priceless, and he went for some no-strings love just like Cameron knew he would.

I almost retched when the worm came out.......I was screaming the whole time until it was finally finished coming out of her.  Truly horrible.

All in all......all the elements I love about House!

American Idol was meh.....I'm ready for the good stuff already.  The judges were cutting people left and right, and I hope they kept some talent.  Sundance was a real letdown, and he so should have been gone.

I finished Season 3 of 24 on my iPod today at work, and it left me in tears.  Jack Bauer is so my hero, and that is so the best show on Earth.  Started on Season 4 right away, and I can't wait until I get caught up so I can actually watch the new episodes.  

I got Robin Thicke's CD, "The Evolution of Robin Thicke", and I love it to death.  I highly recommend it if you like a little R&B flavor.  He's purty cute, too!  :-P

All in all, everything's going okay.  Things are back to normal at work, and I'm back to the boredom, but I won't complain this time!  It could always be worse!

I wish you all a Happy Valentine's Day tomorrow, filled with love.  As for me, I will be dateless, and basically love life-less, so.......yeah, Valentine's Day sucks!  But I don't begrudge you your happiness!

Love, hearts, and chocolate to you all!  :)

So, remember when I was complaining about the boredom of my job?  Well, this morning I walked in to total and utter chaos.  Our computer system was down, and we had to process all our normal orders, plus do care-planning for all our hospice patients on PAPER!  *gasp*  It was truly insane!  Remember that mind stimulation I was talking about?  Well....yeah...um......I got it!  A little too much of it, actually.  I was so frustrated I was nearly in tears.  Please tell me why pharmacists can pass the grueling difficulty of pharmacy school, but they cannot seem to fill out a straightforward form?????  I shall never understand it.  When my shift was over, I was fairly running out the door.  Overtime???  I THINK NOT!

I am hoping all systems will be go tomorrow and I can spend the whole day catching up on my normal work in peace.

ZOMG--Grey's Anatomy!!  It was so great!  I love it when shows do these big disastrous events and it's so intense.  Kourev was so great.....it's times like these that I really love him.  Sometimes it seems like pregnant women and babies are the only thing that can touch his heart.  He was so wonderful when he was talking to that pitiful girl whose face looked awful.  And like WHOA.....could Addyson BE more warm for his form??  That's so going to happen.....and soon.  The little girl with Meredith was breaking my heart.  I knew something awful was going to happen at the end....but I was not expecting *that*.    

Also---I was laughing so hard at Burke, Shepard, Addy, McSteamy, and the chief in the elevator.  They really have brilliant writers on this show.......they can always make me laugh, and never fail to shock me.  I can't freaking believe we have to wait a whole week for the next episode.


I suppose that's all for tonight.....I am so worn out and ready for bed.  I must've forgotten what real work is like LOL!  All this using my brain has tuckered me out.  I hope you are all having a great week.  For those of you under a bunch of snow, or those facing wind chills below zero....STAY WARM and STAY SAFE!   And for those of you with normal to fair weather....just STAY SAFE!  Cuz, ooooooh baby baby, it's a wild world...

Heroes last night was completely awesome.  I figured that would be who Claire's father was, but it stll surprised me in a wierd way......ok, I confess....I screamed LOL!  I couldn't help myself.  I freaking love that show. 

Whoa.  House and the doctor who stole his parking space.  He's so wrong, and I love it!  I am telling you Hugh Laurie is a genius.

LOST comes back tomorrow night!!!  My sis and BIL asked me to go somewhere with them, but I told them I had plans with my television.  Hello.....I've been waiting on this for awhile.

So, I'm kind of sick of my job.  It's so boring.  The only mental stimulation I get is from my iPod.....this is a sad state of affairs.  I thrive on pressure.......I thrive on facing and solving problems.  Something must be done.  I am thinking of going back to school for something.......anything.  The only problem is.........I have bills.  STUPID BILLS.

On the other hand......I make reeeeeeeally good money.  Especially for someone who doesn't have a degree.  And I love most of the people I work with.....I have some really great friends there.  It's all so confusing.

I got a new book this weekend, and it is sooooo good.  Romance writers never write good historicals anymore, and I've been striking out on that front a lot recently, but I haven't been able to put this one down.  "My Wicked Highlander" by Jen Holling.....there's just something about a man in a kilt.

Anywho.....I'm in a wierd mood tonight.  I feel strange, and I don't know why.  Here's a random thought......I just looked at my icon.  Patrick Dempsey is so sexeh!

I hope you are all having a super week......talk to you laterz!

The Superbowl....


Or football in general really...


That's all.

How is it possible that Grey's Anatomy knows JUST how to get me........every time!!!!!!

Such a wonderful episode!  Burke completely surprised me, and Christina's speech was fabulous.  I'm so glad she was the first to break, and the thing about being in it for the long haul.....oh, it just nearly made me cry.  I know how hard that was for her, and I know Burke knew how hard it was for her.  She said she didn't need to win this one........CHRISTINA said she didn't need to win!  It's much too much for my little heart to take.

But then, George comes out with this speech that fairly took my breath away!  I had the same reactions to it as Callie did, I think.  You could just see it all over her face.  Even though I know it is probably a little too convenient with the death of his dad, I can't help but want her to say yes LOL!   At the very least, he deserves some Mclovin' after that.

Derrick and Meredith were sweet as always......I can't help it, I just love them together.  I am totally feeling Addy and Kourev.  McSteamy must stay, cause I need his hotness.  I love Nazi Bailey, and Izzy did the absolute perfect thing with the money.  It was just......right.  I love Callie.  I love her interactions with EVERYONE.  She's a great character.



This episode reminded me of why and just how much I love this show!  Hilarious, poignant, shocking......truly one of the best shows on television, and deserving of every accolade and word of praise it has received.

PS-- For some reason now, I have to put a Mc on everything.  This show seriously (seriously?  seriously!?) changes the way I talk!  I am a Mcnut.

Does it get much better than this??



You can't see it in this picture, but he's looking at me....

Have a good day, peeps!

Watched two movies today......one restored my faith in humanity and one drained it all away again...


We are Marshall...........oh so good!  I cried from the very beginning until the very end.  McConaughey was phenomenal in it (and not even just hotness-wise....he really acted well), and I also enjoy Matthew Fox.  I cannot begin to imagine what that town and that school went through.  The movie was done in a really tasteful and respectful manner, and really emphasized the struggle back from a tragedy instead of the tragedy itself.  It was heartbreaking watching the ones who should have been on the plane deal with that reality, and even harder watching those who lost family members learn to move on.  I highly recommend this flick.......it will make you cry, but it will also leave you with a feeling of hope and a sense of their accomplishment.


The Last Kiss......oh so horrible!  I watched it solely based on the fact that I enjoyed Garden State so much, but I could not have been more disappointed.  The whole movie made me want to hate all men.  The lead character (Zach Braff) had the perfect woman, pregnant with his child, and he pretty much threw it all away for a perky little college chick who practically threw herself at him even after finding out he was attached.  There were some graphic sex scenes that I could have done without, and there was basically only one guy in the entire film that I even thought was a decent human being (hint:  it wasn't Braff's character).  Where the other movie left me with a feeling of hope, this one left me feeling cynical.  I am so a happy ending kind of girl, and even though this ending was "happy", it wasn't the ending I wanted or felt the main character deserved....it was pretty much a waste of my time, and I wouldn't recommend it.  On a brighter note......it had some phenomenal music in it, and I may have to get the soundtrack. 


So anyways.....that's my day.  Also went to Wally World and procured many household items that were in much need.  Hope you're all having a wonderful weekend!

So here is what has been going on in my internetless world......WARNING:  LONG POST AHEAD!  

So it's been a month and a half, and a busy one at that.  December was full of holidays and weddings, moving and adjusting.  I've moved into the house with my sister and her new husband......it's really kind of....awkward LOL!  I mean, I guess it's not that bad, since I mostly just stay in my room and the office (it's sooooo much better now that I have the internet), but still, it's just kind of wierd living with a newlywed couple.  It's all lovey-dovey one minute, and all spit-spat the next.  We're all being really considerate of each other, and it's strange living with a guy.  Let's just say the sun rises and sets with ESPN.....

Christmas was a little different this year as we were all really stressed and more than a little strapped due to the wedding.  It was still pretty great, though, and I got a crapload of gift cards, a jump drive, and other tchotchkies (sp?).  Christmas is my favorite time of year.....I just love the whole mood of it.  Somehow it didn't feel like Christmas this year.....maybe due to the fact that it was freaking 70 degrees here.  I know I live in the South, and we never get snow or anything, but it's usually at least frigid.  Not this year.  

The day after Christmas I woke up sick......turns out I had tonislitis, and i was out of work for several days.  All in all, a horrible, terrible, ugly, no-good experience whose final effects are just now leaving me.  And then it was time for the wedding....

....which turned out beautifully!!!  I will post pictures as soon as we get them back!  It was a long process getting everything ready, but it was so worth it.  My sister had her dream wedding, and that is all that really matters.  Boys can skip ahead, cause here will follow a really weepy, detailed synopsis of the wedding from a girl's (and sister's) point of view:

The day before the wedding all us bridesmaids, my mother, and the bride went to get our nails done.....then we headed to the church to start getting everything ready for the rehearsal dinner.  The rehearsal was nice......we went through everything several times.  Who knew I would have to fluff the freaking train nine billion times.  Any of you future maids of honor just prepare yourself to be on the floor half the ceremony.  After the rehearsal dinner, we stayed at the church until early the next morning making more preparations and cleaning.  We then had to be back up and at the church at 8 the next morning for the final touches before starting to get ready.  Tiredness abounded, and I was in a fine temper up until I finished getting ready and had completed the stuffing of myself into a death contraption known as a bustier and put on a pound of makeup.  After that, I helped my sister get into her dress, and then we got word that my dad wanted to come in and see her before it was time.  My dad walked into the room and put his arms around her and completely broke down.  I am telling you, he was sobbing, Cassie was sobbing, I was sobbing......ok EVERYONE was sobbing.  Then he said, "I love you" and high-tailed it out of the room, leaving behind a gaggle of females wiping their eyes and rushing to get in front of a mirror and replace the pound of makeup we just cried off.  Good times.  My sister made a beautiful bride and everyone else looked really great too.  Her colors were red and black, so our dresses were black with a red sash, and that was great for me, cause black is my signature color LOL!  We finally heard the final seating song, and knew it was just about time for the wedding to begin.  We walked out into the hall, and my sister and I stopped in a room by ourselves so she could fix her garter, and then she asked me to pull her veil over, and then we both started crying again.  An extremely emotional sister moment occurred and we had to check our makeup again.  The parents and grandparents were seated to "The Prayer" by Lauren Tally and David Phelps, and then the bridesmaids walked down the aisle to "I Know You by Heart" by Eva Cassidy which was so perfectly beautiful in the wedding, but which is extremely sloooooow.  I didn't know how fast to walk, and everyone was all walk to the beat of the music......uh hello, it would take 20 minutes for me to do that, so I just went and I looked like an idiot of course LOL!  When I got to the stage, I had to walk up some stairs, and I totally tripped on my dress and almost fell (I knew this was going to happen....).  Then came the ring bearer and the flower girls who were adorable.  The ringbearer lasted about two seconds before he stretched out on the stage, put the pillow under his head, and decided to take a nap.  Oy!  Cassie came out with my dad, and Brandon started crying, which in turn made everyone else start crying, and after that, the rest of the wedding is kind of a blur, cause I was too worried about the durn train.  I thought the preacher did a really nice job, and it all turned out great.  

We took a million and one pictures, and then it was time for the reception.  They had a slideshow of pictures of them growing up and them now, which had everyone in tears again.  Weddings are total weepfests, I have to say.  I had to harrass my sister about the wedding night......you know, going around singing "I'm not a girl, not yet a woman..."  She was totally freaked out, which was understandable, and told me to shut up.  And then they left, and we had to clean up.  All of that is really a blur, too, as I was so freaking tired I could barely see straight, and my feet hurt so bad it was a chore to walk on them.  After all was said and done, we felt like we had accomplished something great, and we were happy because they were happy.  That's the way it should be, I think...

Ok, boys, tune back in, cause now I'm going to talk about electronics!  HOOTY HOO!

I just got myself a video iPod!!!!!  YAYA!  I am in obsession mode with it right now.  I totally watched a movie at work the other day......yes I did!  This iPod rules!  Can you sense my excitement over this??  Now I'm in the process of downloading anything and everything I can get my hands on.  

I know you all read about my date from the depths of Hades....well, here's something new.  We had a concert the second weekend in January, and guess who shows up????  YOU GUESS RIGHT!  Crazy boy.  And he was like the first one there.....an hour early!!!  I am telling you people....I can't take it.  I'm a nice, friendly person, but I'm just not interested!!!!  And he's totally snowed my mother or something, cause she said, "I think you should give him another chance!"  AHHHH!!  Um, no!  Later on in the night I heard him tell someone he had to go.....he was a nervous wreck cause he hadn't taken his medication in 3 days!!!!  I keeed you not!!  First of all.....wierd.....second of all.....why would you just tell that to people....third of all......TAKE YOUR MEDICINE!!!  Scary scary....

I should probably hit the hay soon.....I just finished watching My Super Ex-Girlfriend on my iPod, and it was super cute!  I recommend it for a light, fluffy comedy.  

It's so good to be back and in the loop......I missed you guys!!  Have a fantabulous Monday, and I'll talk to you all soon!

I'm totally freaking out!!!  JK Rowling released the title of Book 7.........
Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows!!


Anyone feel like speculating?  Theorizing?  Squeeing??

SQUEEEEEEEE!

It's me guys!!  I'm alive!!  Can you believe it?  I am bereft without internet......if we don't get it soon, I won't be held accountable for my actions.  I'm so sorry about the lack of comments for you all, but I have been thinking about you and I promise I will be a comment maniac when my internet is restored!  I miss you all, and hope you leave me a comment to let me know you haven't forgotten me!  *tear*

I went to see The Holiday last night and I think it may be my favorite movie of the entire year.....if you are a chick you must see it.  Jude Law is my new number one hottie, and his character in that movie is my love.  The movie just contained every aspect that I love in a movie: romance, humor, hot dudes, and a big fat whopping happy ending.  Seriously....I felt so good afterward. 

I just thought I'd share a synopsis of the hideous date I had Saturday night.......

ok, he picked me up and he was 30 MINUTES EARLY!!!!!!!! I was still getting ready.....grrr
anyways, then we went to eat, and he kept going on and on about he was getting teased about going out with me and people were telling him not to be kissing me and stuff on the first date (believe me, there was so no chance of this happening anyways....), and we went to eat...........here's what I learned at dinner:

His obsessions are 1). NASCAR-- EWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW He has a Nascar cell phone. 2). Elvis-- He told me he took off work to go to the 25th anniversary candlelight vigil at Graceland in the rain---wierd! He has a billion Elvis ringtones on his phone (and I had to hear most of them) 3). Larry the Cable Guy-- He told me he impersonates Larry the Cable Guy and I was subjected to almost all of the material on the Blue Collar Comedy Tour throughout the evening.

He informed me that he got fired from FEDEX, but wouldn't tell me what for.
He informed me that he was on anti-depressants.
He informed me that he was 23.
THEN.......we had two hours to kill before the movie (YIKES!) so we went back to my house where he regaled me with his CD collection and tried to sing along as his voice cracked.

We went to the movies (we saw Happy Feet which was the bright spot of the evening........a really cute movie!!). All night long he's been asking me the same questions over and over and over. I think he has ADD. If we stopped talking for a minute, he'd say "Ok, it's too quiet, Say something!" OY! Here's the point when I literally yelled at him, and our convo is as follows:

HIM: Are you sure you have enough room on the arm rest?
ME: Oh, you're fine.
HIM: Are you sure you really have enough room?
ME: You're fine.
HIM: I know I am, but do you have enough room?
ME: Oh Lord *eye roll*
HIM: I'm just kidding! I'm just kidding! I'm really not like that! Really! I'm just kidding! Just kidding!
ME: I know you're just kidding.
HIM: But are you sure you have enough room on the arm rest?
ME: You're fine *slightly perturbed now*
HIM: Are you sure you don't need more room?
ME: YOU'RE FINE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
HIM: Ok, I won't ask again...
Why me? I ask you....
So he also sweats profusely and was wiping his head with his hands all night long. By the end of the movie he smelled like sweat so bad I was about to gag.

We leave the movie and we drive back to my house, here's the convo we had while I was silently praying for him not to try anything when he dropped me off:

ME: *yawn*
HIM: It's too quiet, say something!
ME: I have nothing to say.......I'm tired...
HIM: So uh, after the holidays, do you wanna do this again sometime?
ME: Call me. (I didn't say he'd reach me LOL)
HIM: Ok, ok, alright uh, ok....
ME: *look out the window, silently praying*
HIM: It's too quiet, say something!
ME: I told you, I'm tired.......I don't know what you want me to say!
HIM: Did you have a good time? Did I scare you?
ME: No, it was fun, thank you
HIM: So uh, after the holidays, you wanna, uh, do this again sometime?
ME: *huff* I said call me!
HIM: Ok, ok....
Then when we got to the door, I unlocked it hurriedly and turned around and said "Thanks!" , waved and walked in shutting the door behind me.

So yeah, good times LOL

Ok, so we got moved in........unfortunately, we got a new house in a new phase of the subdivision, and the cable company says we can't get cable or internet until after January.  Stupidheads...  So we're getting Satellite TV (with DVR thankfully!!) and DSL through the phone company.  I am told this is just as fast, but we shall see.  Unfortunately, the phone company can't make it out until December 18th.  WHAT?????????  Yes, that's right.  It will be two more weeks until we get internet at the house.  I shall go stir crazy.  I have been watching all the DVD's I own.  I miss the internet.  I miss my internet friends.  I am currently on my parent's internet, and I will have to come over here every few days to take care of business.  Could that be more wrong?  Oy! 
 

Now that the rant is over, I will catch you up on my life (if you're still interested...)...

The bachelorette party was a great time.......we went out to eat and then came back to the new house (!) to have a little lingerie party and play games and such.  We played a little game called "honeymoon panties", in which we decorated white cotton panties with magic markers for her wedding night.  Yikes!  Those were hilarious, and also a little bit scary.....and pretty gross for me since it's my sister LOL!  But I digress.....we were up until the butt crack of dawn playing Tabu and Trivial Pursuit Pop Culture, and then got up in the morning, and I fixed breakfast for everyone.  It was just a really fun time all around.  I'm so thankful it turned out alright......as many of you told me it would!  Don't say I told you so!!

Moving was hades as expected, but we got everything in pretty well.  The house looks lovely, and it was all pretty much put together by the time of the party Saturday night.  Unfortunately, ours is the only finished house for a little bit, so we are awakened every morning to the sounds of hammers and bulldozers.  Not too pleasant, really, but what can you do?  My dog, Maddie, HATES all the noise.  She startles at every little sound they make.  She may need to be put on some Xanax by the time they're done LOL!


And that's about it.  I am checking your entries on the kiosk at my work daily, but it's not really feasible for me to comment, seeing as how I can't stand there (yes, there are no chairs....so ghetto) for very long, and people are constantly passing behind me so there's no privacy.  Rest assured, I'm staying informed on your lives and am wishing you all the best.  i will be a comment fool again as soon as the internet gets hooked up........you know.......if it ever does..  GRR!  

Oooh, one last thing....I have my final bridesmaid dress fitting this weekend.  EW!  Dear God, make me a bird, so I can fly far, far far away from this place.

I miss talking with you all!  :(  Don't forget me in my absence.......

MOVING SUCKS!!

I will probably be virtually internetless for the next few days.......I expect to get a lot accomplished.  Talk with  you all on the flip side of this ordeal!  :)

Much love!
